metadata.titleEn: Tibetan soil carbon pool to 3 m depth (2019)
metadata.titleCn: 青藏高原3m深度土壤碳库格点数据（2019）
metadata.description:
This dataset is derived from the paper: Ding, J., Wang, T., Piao, S., Smith, P., Zhang, G., Yan, Z., Ren, S., Liu, D., Wang, S., Chen, S., Dai, F., He, J., Li, Y., Liu, Y., Mao, J., Arain, A., Tian, H., Shi, X., Yang, Y., Zeng, N., & Zhao, L. (2019). The paleoclimatic footprint in the soil carbon stock of the Tibetan permafrost region. Nature Communications, 10(1), 4195. doi:10.1038/s41467-019-12214-5.
This data contains R code and a new estimate of Tibetan soil carbon pool to 3 m depth, at a 0.1° spatial resolution.
Previous assessments of the Tibetan soil carbon pools have relied on a collection of predictors based only on modern climate and remote sensing-based vegetation features. Here, researchers have merged modern climate and remote sensing-based methods common in previous estimates, with paleoclimate, landform and soil geochemical properties in multiple machine learning algorithms, to make a new estimate of the permafrost soil carbon pool to 3 m depth over the Tibetan Plateau, and find that the stock (38.9-34.2 Pg C) is triple that predicted by ecosystem models (11.5 ± 4.2 Pg C), which use pre-industrial climate to initialize the soil carbon pool. This study provides evidence that illustrates, for the first time, the bias caused by the lack of paleoclimate information in ecosystem models.
The data contains the following fields:
Longitude (°E)
Latitude (°N)
SOCD (0-30cm) (kg C m-2)
SOCD (0-300cm) (kg C m-2)
GridArea (k㎡)
3mCstcok (10^6 kg C)

本数据集来源于论文：Ding, J., Wang, T., Piao, S., Smith, P., Zhang, G., Yan, Z., Ren, S., Liu, D., Wang, S., Chen, S., Dai, F., He, J., Li, Y., Liu, Y., Mao, J., Arain, A., Tian, H., Shi, X., Yang, Y., Zeng, N., & Zhao, L. (2019). The paleoclimatic footprint in the soil carbon stock of the Tibetan permafrost region. Nature Communications, 10(1), 4195. doi:10.1038/s41467-019-12214-5. 
数据中包含新评估的青藏高原3m深度土壤有机碳库格点数据及相应的R代码，格点数据空间分辨率为0.1°。
以往对青藏高原土壤碳库的评估多以现代气候、植被等特性为根据，未考虑古气候条件、土层厚度等因素的影响。本研究中，研究人员综合考虑了古气候和现代气候条件、土层厚度和土壤理化属性、植被和地形等因素，通过机器学习算法重新评估了青藏高原3m深度土壤碳库。新评估得到的青藏高原土壤碳储量为36.6 Pg C (38.9-34.2 Pg C)，约为陆地生态系统模型模拟均值的3倍(11.5±4.2 Pg C)。同时，研究指出，模型中缺乏对古气候影响的考虑是导致模拟偏差的重要原因。
数据中包含以下字段：
Longitude (°E)
Latitude (°N)
SOCD (0-30cm) (kg C m-2)
SOCD (0-300cm) (kg C m-2)
GridArea (k㎡)
3mCstcok (10^6 kg C)

background: Tibetan permafrost largely formed during the late Pleistocene glacial period and shrank in the Holocene Thermal Maximum period. Quantifying the impacts of paleoclimatic extremes on soil carbon stock can shed light on the vulnerability of permafrost carbon in the future. There is evidence that the paleoclimate has influenced the cycling of soil carbon through shifting biomes and by altering soil physiochemical properties. Land regions of permafrost constitute the largest soil carbon pool in terrestrial ecosystems, and, with an area of 1.06 million km2, the Tibetan Plateau is the largest alpine permafrost area outside the polar regions. Evidence from preserved relict permafrost and periglacial phenomena indicate that the main body of the existing Tibetan permafrost was formed during the last glaciation period, at the end of the late Pleistocene, which was characterised by cold and arid periglacial environments.
research objective: Understanding the influence of past climate extremes on Tibetan soil carbon could shed light on the vulnerability of the permafrost soil carbon pool to future climate change. Here, we compile data from 1114 sites collected during 11 field campaigns across the Tibetan permafrost region, and use multiple statistical techniques to assess the relative importance of climates from the last glacial maximum (LGM), an extremely cold period 22,000 years ago; the mid-Holocene (MidH), a hypsithermal period about 6000 years ago; and the modern climate (1975–2015) in driving the current spatial pattern of permafrost soil carbon.
challenges: However, the small number of deep sample sites on the plateau (only 11 cores are available), and their severely biased spatial distribution, means that it’s currently impossible to make a reliable soil carbon estimate for the whole plateau for depths greater than 3 m.
methods: We have synthesized soil data collected from 1114 sites during 11 field campaigns conducted by multiple research teams over the past three decades. Soil organic carbon density (SOCD, kg C m−2) was estimated based on soil organic carbon concentration (SOCC, g kg−1), bulk density (BD, g cm−3), soil layer depth (T, cm) and rock (diameter larger than 2 mm) content (C, %) in layer i, using the following formulation. Since all sites have data for the top 30 cm soil layer, we first assessed the relative contributions of paleo- and modern climate using 30 cm SOCD. The missing values of BD (21%) were estimated using pedotransfer functions between SOCC and BD, while missing rock content values (29%) were estimated by using the mean values for the same soil type. The full data set includes 325 sites with deep soil data (extending to more than 200 cm in depth), with SOCD data for seven different layers: 0–10, 10–20, 20–30, 30–50, 50–100, 100–200 and 200–300 cm. We compiled a climate data set composed of climate over the period 1975–2015 (modern climate), and paleoclimates in the mid-Holocene (MidH) and the Last Glacial Maximum (LGM). Principle component analysis was used for the climate variables in each period to eliminate multicollinearity. We synthesized data with multiple key soil physical (i.e., soil moisture and texture), and geochemical factors, such as CEC, K, P and pH. The spatially explicit soil property data were sourced from publicly available databases or were derived from spatial interpolation of site observations as described below. The climate (both modern and paleoclimate) and soil properties data were used to assess the relative importance of modern and paleoclimate in affecting modern soil carbon stock using a variety of statistical methods, and then subjected to the SVM model to predict the modern carbon stock over the entire study region. We used a combined approach involving multiple statistical models to analyse the relative importance of paleo- and modern climate. Specifically, random forest analysis was used to rank the relative importance of the predictors. Variation partitioning modelling was used to identify the relative importance of paleoclimate and modern climate on soil carbon stock. Structural equation modelling (SEM) was used to identify the direct and indirect (via soil properties) effects of paleoclimate on soil carbon stock, and to evaluate the contributions of these factors by assessing the degree of the standardized total effect (direct effect plus indirect effect). In addition, we used partial correlation analysis between the soil carbon stock and the current climate with soil variables controlled separately, and with all soil properties controlled, to identify the effect of the current climate on the soil carbon stock. We quantified the relative contributions of the regressors using the Lindeman–Merenda–Gold method. We calculated the freezing index (FI, Eqs.2–3) for LGM and MidH periods using paleoclimate simulations from the CCSM model, and analysed the relative change of the freezing index from LGM to MidH to infer the change of permafrost extent. Here, we used several different machine learning algorithms to estimate SOCD over the permafrost regions of the Tibetan Plateau. We, therefore, used SVM and a high resolution (250 m) soil depth data set to estimate the top 30 cm soil carbon stock in a spatially explicit manner over the permafrost regions of the Tibetan Plateau. An uncertainty estimate that originated from sampling sites and vertical interpolation of soil carbon stock was provided for the estimation of soil carbon stock on the Tibetan Plateau. To account for the uncertainty introduced by sampling sites, we adopted a bootstrap method (random sampling with replacement) to generate 1000 pseudo replicates, which were used to establish the SVM model in estimating the 30 cm soil carbon stock. We used soil carbon simulations from the SG3 scenario, with time-varying forcing of climate, land use history and atmospheric CO2 concentration, for the period 1975-2010, and resampled the output to 0.1o resolution to facilitate comparison with the observation-based predictions. We used the Comparison Map Profile (CMP) method to examine spatial similarity between the output of the models and our estimate.
dataset: Here, we compile data from 1114 sites collected during 11 field campaigns across the Tibetan permafrost region.
findings: Our results show that paleoclimate is more important than the modern climate in determining current soil carbon stocks, and its importance increases progressively with soil depth. When we include paleoclimate as an additional predictor in a machine learning algorithm to re-assess Tibetan soil carbon stocks in the top three metres of the soil, we find that the present generation of terrestrial ecosystem models are biased towards low soil carbon stocks, highlighting the need to include paleoclimate information in soil carbon model initialization.
backgroundCn: 藏区的永久冻土主要形成于晚更新世冰川期，并在全新世温暖期缩小。量化古气候极端事件对土壤碳储量的影响可以揭示未来永久冻土碳的脆弱性。有证据表明，古气候通过生物群落的变化和土壤理化性质的改变影响了土壤碳的循环。永久冻土地区构成了陆地生态系统中最大的土壤碳库，而藏区以106万平方公里的面积成为极地以外最大的高山永久冻土区。来自保存的遗留永久冻土和冻土现象的证据表明，现有藏区永久冻土的主要部分是在最后冰川期形成的，那个时期的特点是寒冷和干旱的冻土环境。
research objectiveCn: 理解过去气候极端事件对西藏土壤碳的影响，可以揭示未来气候变化对永冻土壤碳库的脆弱性。在这里，我们汇编了来自1114个地点的数据，这些数据是在西藏永冻土地区进行的11次实地考察中收集的，并使用多种统计技术评估最后冰期（LGM，22000年前的极冷时期）、中全新世（MidH，约6000年前的温暖时期）和现代气候（1975-2015年）在驱动当前永冻土壤碳空间分布模式中的相对重要性。
challengesCn: 然而，平台上深层采样点数量较少（仅有11个核心样本可用），且其空间分布严重偏倚，因此目前无法对整个平台在超过3米深度的土壤碳进行可靠估算。
methodsCn: 我们合成了在过去三十年中由多个研究团队进行的11次实地考察收集的1114个地点的土壤数据。土壤有机碳密度（SOCD，kg C m−2）是基于土壤有机碳浓度（SOCC，g kg−1）、容重（BD，g cm−3）、土层深度（T，cm）和岩石（直径大于2 mm）含量（C，%）在层i中的估算。由于所有地点都有30 cm土层的数据，我们首先评估了古气候和现代气候对30 cm SOCD的相对贡献。缺失的BD值（21%）通过SOCC与BD之间的土壤转移函数进行估算，而缺失的岩石含量值（29%）则通过使用相同土壤类型的平均值进行估算。完整的数据集包括325个深土数据点（深度超过200 cm），具有七个不同层次的SOCD数据：0–10、10–20、20–30、30–50、50–100、100–200和200–300 cm。我们编制了一个气候数据集，涵盖1975年至2015年的气候（现代气候），以及中全新世（MidH）和最后冰期最大期（LGM）的古气候。对每个时期的气候变量进行了主成分分析，以消除多重共线性。我们综合了多个关键的土壤物理（如土壤水分和质地）和地球化学因素，如阳离子交换容量（CEC）、钾（K）、磷（P）和pH值。空间显式的土壤属性数据来自公开可用的数据库或通过对现场观测的空间插值得出。气候（包括现代气候和古气候）和土壤属性数据用于评估现代气候和古气候对现代土壤碳储量的相对重要性，采用多种统计方法进行分析，然后通过支持向量机（SVM）模型预测整个研究区域的现代碳储量。我们采用了结合多种统计模型的方法来分析古气候和现代气候的相对重要性。具体而言，随机森林分析用于对预测变量的重要性进行排名。变异分解建模用于识别古气候和现代气候对土壤碳储量的相对重要性。结构方程模型（SEM）用于识别古气候对土壤碳储量的直接和间接（通过土壤属性）影响，并通过评估标准化总效应（直接效应加间接效应）来评估这些因素的贡献。此外，我们使用偏相关分析在控制土壤变量的情况下，分别分析土壤碳储量与当前气候之间的关系，并在控制所有土壤属性的情况下，识别当前气候对土壤碳储量的影响。我们使用林德曼-梅伦达-戈德方法量化回归变量的相对贡献。我们使用CCSM模型的古气候模拟计算了LGM和MidH时期的冰冻指数（FI，Eqs.2–3），并分析了从LGM到MidH冰冻指数的相对变化，以推断永冻土范围的变化。因此，我们使用几种不同的机器学习算法来估算青藏高原的永冻土区域的SOCD。我们因此使用SVM和高分辨率（250 m）的土壤深度数据集，以空间显式的方式估算青藏高原永冻土区域的前30 cm土壤碳储量。我们提供了一个不确定性估计，该估计源于采样地点和土壤碳储量的垂直插值，以便于青藏高原土壤碳储量的估算。为了考虑采样地点引入的不确定性，我们采用了自助法（带替换的随机抽样）生成1000个伪重复样本，这些样本用于建立SVM模型以估算30 cm土壤碳储量。我们使用SG3情景下的土壤碳模拟，考虑了气候、土地利用历史和大气CO2浓度的时间变化强迫，时间范围为1975-2010年，并将输出重采样至0.1°分辨率，以便与基于观测的预测进行比较。我们使用比较地图轮廓（CMP）方法检查模型输出与我们的估计之间的空间相似性。
datasetCn: 在西藏永冻土地区，我们汇编了在11次实地考察中收集的1114个地点的数据。
findingsCn: 我们的研究结果表明，古气候在决定当前土壤碳储量方面比现代气候更为重要，并且其重要性随着土壤深度的增加而逐渐增强。当我们将古气候作为额外的预测因子纳入机器学习算法，以重新评估青藏高原土壤在前三米的碳储量时，我们发现当前的陆地生态系统模型在土壤碳储量方面存在低估的偏差，这突显了在土壤碳模型初始化中纳入古气候信息的必要性。

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are the main data collection methods for assessing soil carbon stocks in the Tibetan permafrost region based on field campaigns, machine learning models, or satellite data?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 评估西藏永冻土地区土壤碳储量的主要数据收集方法是基于实地考察、机器学习模型还是卫星数据？
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 实地活动，机器学习模型

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the assessment of soil organic carbon density (SOCD) in the Tibetan Plateau primarily reliant on pedotransfer functions, spatial interpolation, or direct measurement?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 青藏高原土壤有机碳密度（SOCD）的评估主要依赖于土壤传递函数、空间插值还是直接测量？
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 土壤转移函数和空间插值

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What methods are used to estimate soil organic carbon density in the Tibetan permafrost region?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在西藏永久冻土地区，估算土壤有机碳密度的方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Soil organic carbon concentration, bulk density, soil layer depth, rock content
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 土壤有机碳浓度、体积密度、土层深度、岩石含量

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where were the data collection sites located for assessing soil carbon stock in the Tibetan Plateau?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 评估青藏高原土壤碳储量的数据收集地点位于哪里？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What statistical methods are employed to analyze the importance of paleoclimate on soil carbon stock?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 分析古气候对土壤碳储量重要性的统计方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: random forest analysis, variation partitioning modeling, structural equation modeling, partial correlation analysis
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 随机森林分析，变异分解建模，结构方程模型，偏相关分析

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in estimating soil carbon stocks for the Tibetan Plateau at depths greater than 3 meters?
Example.QuestionCn: 在估计青藏高原深度超过3米的土壤碳储量时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A significant challenge in estimating soil carbon stocks for depths greater than 3 meters on the Tibetan Plateau is the limited number of deep sampling sites, with only 11 cores available, and their severely biased spatial distribution, making it difficult to make reliable estimates for the entire plateau.
Example.AnswerCn: 在估算青藏高原深度超过3米的土壤碳储量时，一个显著的挑战是深度采样点数量有限，仅有11个核心样本，并且它们的空间分布严重偏倚，这使得对整个高原进行可靠估计变得困难。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you give an example of a data collection method used in examining the influence of past climate extremes on soil carbon in the Tibetan permafrost region?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否举一个在研究过去气候极端对青藏高原永冻土地区土壤碳影响时使用的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: Data collection involved synthesizing soil data from 1114 sites across the Tibetan permafrost region, collected during 11 field campaigns over three decades. The data included soil organic carbon concentration, bulk density, soil layer depth, and rock content, with missing values estimated using pedotransfer functions and mean values for the same soil type.
Example.AnswerCn: 数据收集涉及对青藏高原永冻土地区1114个地点的土壤数据进行综合，这些数据是在三十年间的11次实地考察中收集的。数据包括土壤有机碳浓度、容重、土壤层深度和岩石含量，缺失值通过土壤传递函数和相同土壤类型的均值进行估算。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key factors considered when estimating soil organic carbon density (SOCD) in permafrost regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在估算永久冻土地区土壤有机碳密度（SOCD）时，考虑的关键因素是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: soil organic carbon concentration, bulk density, soil layer depth, rock content
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 土壤有机碳浓度、容重、土层深度、岩石含量

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with collecting soil carbon data in the Tibetan Plateau permafrost region?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原永久冻土地区收集土壤碳数据面临哪些挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: small number of deep sample sites, severely biased spatial distribution
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 深度采样点数量少，空间分布严重偏斜。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What statistical methods are employed to assess the impact of paleoclimate on soil carbon stock in permafrost regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 评估古气候对永久冻土地区土壤碳储量影响的统计方法有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: random forest analysis, variation partitioning modeling, structural equation modeling, partial correlation analysis, machine learning algorithms like SVM
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 随机森林分析，变异分解建模，结构方程模型，偏相关分析，支持向量机等机器学习算法。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many field campaigns contributed to the data collection across the Tibetan permafrost region?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 有多少次实地考察为西藏永久冻土地区的数据收集做出了贡献？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many soil layers were considered for Soil Organic Carbon Density data in the compiled dataset?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在编制的数据集中考虑了多少个土壤层用于土壤有机碳密度数据？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'soil organic carbon density (SOCD)' mean in the context of soil carbon assessment?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在土壤碳评估的背景下，“土壤有机碳密度（SOCD）”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of soil carbon assessment, 'soil organic carbon density (SOCD)' refers to the amount of carbon stored in a given volume of soil layer, expressed in kilograms of carbon per square meter (kg C m−2). It is estimated based on soil organic carbon concentration, bulk density, soil layer depth, and rock content.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在土壤碳评估的背景下，“土壤有机碳密度（SOCD）”指的是在给定土层体积中储存的碳量，以每平方米千克碳（kg C m−2）表示。它是基于土壤有机碳浓度、容重、土层深度和岩石含量进行估算的。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'structural equation modelling (SEM)' entail in relation to analyzing soil carbon stock influences?
Definition.QuestionCn: 结构方程模型（SEM）在分析土壤碳储量影响方面涉及什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Structural equation modelling (SEM) is a statistical technique used to identify the direct and indirect effects of variables like paleoclimate on soil carbon stock. It evaluates the contributions of these factors by assessing the degree of the standardized total effect, which includes both direct and indirect effects via soil properties.
Definition.AnswerCn: 结构方程模型（SEM）是一种统计技术，用于识别变量（如古气候）对土壤碳储量的直接和间接影响。它通过评估标准化总效应的程度来评估这些因素的贡献，该总效应包括通过土壤性质的直接和间接效应。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do paleoclimate data integration in soil carbon stock models differ from models that use only modern climate data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 古气候数据在土壤碳储量模型中的整合与仅使用现代气候数据的模型有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Models that integrate paleoclimate data consider historical climatic conditions, which have been shown to have a significant impact on current soil carbon stocks, especially at greater soil depths. In contrast, models using only modern climate data tend to underestimate soil carbon stocks, as they do not account for the influence of past climate extremes on soil carbon cycling.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 整合古气候数据的模型考虑了历史气候条件，这些条件已被证明对当前土壤碳储量有显著影响，尤其是在较深的土壤层中。相比之下，仅使用现代气候数据的模型往往低估土壤碳储量，因为它们未能考虑过去气候极端事件对土壤碳循环的影响。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the variations in data synthesis approaches between field campaigns conducted over different decades in terms of soil and climate data collection?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 不同年代的实地考察在土壤和气候数据收集方面的数据合成方法有哪些变化？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Soil and climate data synthesis approaches have evolved to include a combination of site observations, spatial interpolation, and publicly available databases. Over the decades, modern climate data from 1975–2015 and paleoclimate reconstructions from periods such as the LGM and MidH have been compiled, with techniques like PCA used to handle multicollinearity, reflecting advancements in both methodological rigor and data integration capabilities.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 土壤和气候数据综合方法已经发展为结合现场观察、空间插值和公开可用数据库。几十年来，1975年至2015年的现代气候数据和如最后冰期（LGM）和中期暖期（MidH）等时期的古气候重建数据已被汇编，使用主成分分析（PCA）等技术来处理多重共线性，反映了方法论的严格性和数据整合能力的进步。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What underlying factors could explain the significant influence of paleoclimate on current soil carbon stocks in the Tibetan permafrost region?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 哪些潜在因素可以解释古气候对西藏永冻土地区当前土壤碳储量的显著影响？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The significant influence of paleoclimate on current soil carbon stocks could be explained by the historical formation of Tibetan permafrost during the late Pleistocene glacial period, which affected soil physiochemical properties and biome shifts. These historical climate conditions may have left a lasting impact on soil carbon cycling, making them a crucial determinant of current carbon stocks.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 古气候对当前土壤碳储量的显著影响可以通过青藏高原在晚更新世冰川期形成的永久冻土来解释，这影响了土壤的物理化学特性和生物群落的变化。这些历史气候条件可能对土壤碳循环产生了持久的影响，使其成为当前碳储量的重要决定因素。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors have historically influenced the selection of sites for soil carbon data collection in permafrost regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 历史上，影响永久冻土地区土壤碳数据收集地点选择的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The selection of sites for soil carbon data collection in permafrost regions has been influenced by the availability of access to deep sample sites, with only a limited number of cores available and a severely biased spatial distribution.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在永冻土地区，土壤碳数据收集地点的选择受到深层样本点可达性的影响，只有有限数量的岩心可用，并且空间分布严重偏倚。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why might researchers choose to use machine learning algorithms in the assessment of soil carbon stocks?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 研究人员可能选择使用机器学习算法来评估土壤碳储量的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Researchers might choose to use machine learning algorithms in the assessment of soil carbon stocks to incorporate both modern and paleoclimatic data, allowing for a more comprehensive evaluation that addresses biases in terrestrial ecosystem models, particularly at greater soil depths.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 研究人员可能选择使用机器学习算法来评估土壤碳储量，以结合现代和古气候数据，从而进行更全面的评估，解决陆地生态系统模型在较大土壤深度上的偏差问题。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What could be the reasons for discrepancies in soil carbon stock estimations between different modeling approaches?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 不同建模方法之间土壤碳储量估算差异的原因可能有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Discrepancies in soil carbon stock estimations between different modeling approaches could be due to the lack of consideration for paleoclimatic influences in some models, which have been shown to play a significant role in determining current soil carbon stocks.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 不同建模方法之间土壤碳储量估算的差异可能是由于某些模型未考虑古气候影响，而古气候已被证明在决定当前土壤碳储量方面发挥了重要作用。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of integrating paleoclimate data into the analysis of soil carbon stocks in the Tibetan permafrost region?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将古气候数据整合到对青藏高原永冻土地区土壤碳储量的分析中可能产生的结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating paleoclimate data into the analysis of soil carbon stocks in the Tibetan permafrost region can lead to more accurate estimates of current soil carbon stocks. The findings indicate that paleoclimate plays a more crucial role than modern climate in determining current soil carbon stocks, especially with increasing soil depth. This integration can also reveal biases in current terrestrial ecosystem models, which often underestimate soil carbon stocks by neglecting paleoclimate influences.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将古气候数据整合到对青藏高原永冻土区土壤碳储量的分析中，可以更准确地估计当前的土壤碳储量。研究结果表明，古气候在决定当前土壤碳储量方面比现代气候更为重要，尤其是在土壤深度增加的情况下。这种整合还可以揭示当前陆地生态系统模型中的偏差，这些模型往往低估土壤碳储量，因为忽视了古气候的影响。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using a climate dataset that includes both modern and paleoclimate data on the understanding of permafrost soil carbon vulnerability?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用包含现代和古气候数据的气候数据集对理解永冻土土壤碳脆弱性的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a climate dataset that includes both modern and paleoclimate data can provide a deeper understanding of permafrost soil carbon vulnerability by highlighting the significant influence of past climate conditions on current soil carbon stocks. This comprehensive dataset allows researchers to assess the relative importance of different climatic periods, which is crucial for predicting how future climate change might affect the permafrost soil carbon pool. The analysis demonstrates that the effects of paleoclimate are substantial and should be considered in models to avoid underestimating soil carbon stocks.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用包含现代和古气候数据的气候数据集可以更深入地理解永冻土土壤碳的脆弱性，因为它突显了过去气候条件对当前土壤碳储量的显著影响。这个综合数据集使研究人员能够评估不同气候时期的相对重要性，这对于预测未来气候变化可能如何影响永冻土土壤碳库至关重要。分析表明，古气候的影响是显著的，应在模型中加以考虑，以避免低估土壤碳储量。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to integrate paleoclimate data with modern climate data when assessing soil carbon stocks in permafrost regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在评估永久冻土地区的土壤碳储量时，将古气候数据与现代气候数据结合起来是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Integrating paleoclimate data is crucial because the paleoclimate has influenced soil carbon cycling by shifting biomes and altering soil physiochemical properties. Understanding its impact on current soil carbon stocks helps reveal the vulnerability of permafrost carbon to future climate changes and addresses biases in terrestrial ecosystem models that often underestimate soil carbon stocks.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 整合古气候数据至关重要，因为古气候通过改变生物群落和土壤的物理化学特性影响了土壤碳循环。了解其对当前土壤碳储量的影响有助于揭示永冻土碳对未来气候变化的脆弱性，并解决陆地生态系统模型中常常低估土壤碳储量的偏差。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are involved in synthesizing soil data from multiple sites to ensure comprehensive coverage of the Tibetan permafrost region?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 合成来自多个地点的土壤数据以确保对西藏永冻土地区的全面覆盖涉及哪些程序步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil data is synthesized from 1114 sites collected during 11 field campaigns. The synthesis involves estimating soil organic carbon density (SOCD) based on soil organic carbon concentration, bulk density, soil layer depth, and rock content. Missing values are estimated using pedotransfer functions and mean values for the same soil type. Climate data from different periods is also compiled and analyzed using principal component analysis to eliminate multicollinearity.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤数据是从1114个地点在11次实地考察中收集的。合成过程涉及基于土壤有机碳浓度、容重、土壤层深度和岩石含量来估算土壤有机碳密度（SOCD）。缺失值通过土壤传递函数和相同土壤类型的均值进行估算。不同时间段的气候数据也被汇编并使用主成分分析进行分析，以消除多重共线性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are machine learning algorithms applied to evaluate soil carbon stocks across the Tibetan Plateau, and what methods are used to handle uncertainty in the estimates?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 机器学习算法如何应用于评估青藏高原的土壤碳储量，以及使用哪些方法来处理估算中的不确定性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Machine learning algorithms, specifically SVM, are used to estimate soil organic carbon density over the permafrost regions. High-resolution soil depth data and climate data are utilized to predict soil carbon stock. To handle uncertainty, a bootstrap method is employed to generate 1000 pseudo replicates, which helps establish the SVM model for estimating soil carbon stock. Uncertainty from sampling sites and vertical interpolation is accounted for in the estimation process.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 机器学习算法，特别是支持向量机（SVM），被用于估计永久冻土地区的土壤有机碳密度。高分辨率的土壤深度数据和气候数据被用来预测土壤碳储量。为了处理不确定性，采用自助法生成1000个伪重复样本，这有助于建立SVM模型以估计土壤碳储量。在估计过程中，考虑了采样点和垂直插值带来的不确定性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to assess the impact of paleoclimate and modern climate on current soil carbon stocks, and how is the relative importance of these factors determined?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于评估古气候和现代气候对当前土壤碳储量影响的程序有哪些，以及如何确定这些因素的相对重要性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The impact of paleoclimate and modern climate on soil carbon stocks is assessed using a variety of statistical methods, including random forest analysis, variation partitioning modeling, and structural equation modeling. These methods help rank the relative importance of predictors and identify direct and indirect effects of paleoclimate. Partial correlation analysis is also used to control for soil variables and determine the effect of the current climate. The Lindeman–Merenda–Gold method is employed to quantify the contributions of regressors.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 通过多种统计方法评估古气候和现代气候对土壤碳储量的影响，包括随机森林分析、变异分解建模和结构方程建模。这些方法有助于对预测因子的相对重要性进行排名，并识别古气候的直接和间接影响。同时，部分相关分析也被用来控制土壤变量，以确定当前气候的影响。采用林德曼–梅伦达–戈德方法量化回归变量的贡献。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the accurate assessment of soil carbon stocks in the Tibetan permafrost region?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够准确评估西藏永冻土地区的土壤碳储量？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The assessment of soil carbon stocks in the Tibetan permafrost region is enabled by synthesizing soil data collected from 1114 sites during 11 field campaigns over the past three decades. These methods include the use of soil organic carbon concentration, bulk density, soil layer depth, and rock content, along with modern and paleoclimate data, to estimate soil organic carbon density using machine learning algorithms.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在过去三十年中，通过对1114个地点进行的11次实地考察，评估了西藏永冻土地区的土壤碳储量。这些方法包括使用土壤有机碳浓度、容重、土层深度和岩石含量，以及现代和古气候数据，利用机器学习算法估算土壤有机碳密度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological and methodological advancements enable the integration of paleoclimate data in soil carbon stock modeling?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术和方法上的进展使得古气候数据能够融入土壤碳储量建模中？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of paleoclimate data in soil carbon stock modeling is enabled by using paleoclimate simulations, such as those from the CCSM model, and employing advanced statistical techniques like principle component analysis to handle multicollinearity in climate variables, as well as using machine learning models to incorporate paleoclimate as a predictor in soil carbon stock assessments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 古气候数据在土壤碳储量建模中的整合是通过使用古气候模拟（例如CCSM模型）以及采用先进的统计技术（如主成分分析）来处理气候变量中的多重共线性，同时使用机器学习模型将古气候作为土壤碳储量评估中的预测变量。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection efforts in the Tibetan permafrost region encounter significant challenges in obtaining reliable soil carbon estimates for depths greater than 3 meters?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在西藏永久冻土地区进行数据收集时，在获取超过3米深度的可靠土壤碳估算方面可能会遇到重大挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The small number of deep sample sites on the plateau and their severely biased spatial distribution make it currently impossible to make a reliable soil carbon estimate for the whole plateau for depths greater than 3 meters.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于高原上深层采样点数量较少且空间分布严重偏倚，目前无法对整个高原深度超过3米的土壤碳进行可靠估算。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the anticipated challenges in using modern climate data alone to predict current soil carbon stocks in permafrost regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 仅使用现代气候数据来预测永久冻土地区当前土壤碳储量的预期挑战是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Modern climate data alone may not be sufficient to predict current soil carbon stocks because paleoclimate conditions have been shown to be more important than modern climate in determining current soil carbon stocks, particularly as soil depth increases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 仅依靠现代气候数据可能不足以预测当前的土壤碳储量，因为古气候条件已被证明在决定当前土壤碳储量方面比现代气候更为重要，特别是在土壤深度增加的情况下。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to include paleoclimate data when using machine learning algorithms to reassess soil carbon stocks in the Tibetan Plateau?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在使用机器学习算法重新评估青藏高原的土壤碳储量时，包含古气候数据的重要性是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Including paleoclimate data is crucial because the present generation of terrestrial ecosystem models are biased towards low soil carbon stocks. Incorporating paleoclimate information can help correct these biases and improve model accuracy for soil carbon stocks.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 包括古气候数据是至关重要的，因为目前一代陆地生态系统模型对低土壤碳储量存在偏差。纳入古气候信息可以帮助纠正这些偏差，提高土壤碳储量模型的准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do the current methodologies for estimating soil carbon stocks in the Tibetan Plateau account for the impact of paleoclimate and modern climate conditions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 目前对青藏高原土壤碳储量的估算方法如何考虑古气候和现代气候条件的影响？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Current methodologies use a variety of statistical techniques to assess the relative importance of paleoclimate and modern climate. These methods include random forest analysis, variation partitioning modelling, and structural equation modelling to evaluate the direct and indirect effects of paleoclimate on soil carbon stocks. Machine learning algorithms, such as SVM, are also used to predict soil carbon stocks by incorporating climatic data from different periods.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的方法论使用多种统计技术来评估古气候和现代气候的相对重要性。这些方法包括随机森林分析、变异分区建模和结构方程建模，以评估古气候对土壤碳储量的直接和间接影响。机器学习算法，如支持向量机（SVM），也被用来通过结合不同时间段的气候数据来预测土壤碳储量。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the challenges faced in accurately estimating soil carbon stocks for depths greater than 3 meters in the Tibetan Plateau, and what approaches could potentially address these challenges?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在青藏高原，准确估计超过3米深度的土壤碳储量面临的挑战有哪些？可以采取哪些方法来应对这些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: A significant challenge is the small number of deep sample sites and their biased spatial distribution, which makes reliable estimates difficult for depths greater than 3 meters. Addressing these challenges could involve increasing the number of deep sampling sites and employing more sophisticated spatial interpolation methods or machine learning models to better predict soil carbon stocks across the plateau.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 一个显著的挑战是深层采样点数量少且空间分布偏倚，这使得在3米以下的深度进行可靠估计变得困难。解决这些挑战可以通过增加深层采样点的数量以及采用更复杂的空间插值方法或机器学习模型来更好地预测高原地区的土壤碳储量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand why multiple statistical models are needed to evaluate the impact of past and modern climates on soil carbon stocks.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白为什么需要多个统计模型来评估过去和现代气候对土壤碳储量的影响。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Multiple statistical models are employed to capture the complex interactions and relative importance of various factors affecting soil carbon stocks. Techniques like random forest analysis, variation partitioning, and structural equation modeling allow researchers to disentangle the direct and indirect effects of paleoclimate and modern climate, providing a comprehensive understanding of their impacts.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 多种统计模型被用于捕捉影响土壤碳储量的各种因素之间的复杂相互作用和相对重要性。随机森林分析、变异分解和结构方程模型等技术使研究人员能够理清古气候和现代气候的直接和间接影响，从而提供对其影响的全面理解。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please suggest potential datasets or sources that could be integrated with existing soil carbon research to improve the understanding of soil carbon dynamics in the Tibetan permafrost region.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请建议潜在的数据集或来源，这些数据集或来源可以与现有的土壤碳研究相结合，以提高对青藏高原永冻土地区土壤碳动态的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include spatially explicit soil property data sourced from publicly available databases, climate data from modern and paleoclimate periods, and additional soil physical and geochemical factors like soil moisture, texture, CEC, K, P, and pH. Integrating these datasets with existing research can enhance the understanding of soil carbon dynamics by providing a more comprehensive view of the factors affecting carbon stocks.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括来自公开数据库的空间显式土壤属性数据、现代和古气候时期的气候数据，以及其他土壤物理和地球化学因素，如土壤湿度、质地、阳离子交换容量（CEC）、钾（K）、磷（P）和pH值。将这些数据集与现有研究整合，可以通过提供更全面的碳储量影响因素视角，增强对土壤碳动态的理解。
